people_also_ask.question: What is the meaning behind mother?
people_also_ask.heading: mother! is an allegory about God and the Earth. ... From there, the story attempts to be a biblical allegory of both the Old and New Testament as well as a brief, deeply misanthropic view of human history. Ed Harris' man represents Adam.15-Sep-2017
people_also_ask.title: Mother Movie Explained: What Darren Aronofsky's Film Means

people_also_ask.question: Why do they eat the baby in mother?
people_also_ask.heading: She gives birth but refuses to let the poet take the baby to the throng of onlookers downstairs. Unfortunately, as sleep deprivation gets the best of her, the poet snatches the baby from her arms and gives it to the people. The baby, in this instance, is Jesus Christ.15-Sep-2017
people_also_ask.title: Mother Movie Ending Explained - Collider

people_also_ask.question: Is mother a disturbing movie?
people_also_ask.heading: It's also more frequently fascinatingly uncomfortable than it is entertaining. “Mother!” is a weird, wild and wickedly creative nightmare — think of “Rosemary's Baby” meets “The Shining” to have a feel for the tone — as well as being an epic story told on a small scale and in a disturbing manner.15-Sep-2017
people_also_ask.title: 'Mother!' is disturbing freak-out of art meets activism | Movies

knowledge_panel.description: a poet and his wife lead a tranquil existence in a burnt-out house. however, when uninvited guests come barging in, the couple's life turns chaotic and shocking events unfold.
